question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: event_v2_translator.rs] [State resource lookup] When UriMutation is translated to V1 events, if the TokenEventStoreV1 resource is missing, can this cause event loss or indexer inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: event_v2_translator.rs] [Sequence number manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate sequence numbers during V2-to-V1 translation by racing event emissions, causing event ordering issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: event_v2_translator.rs] [Creator address mismatch] If creator() returns a different address than expected during translation, can this cause events to be attributed to wrong accounts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: event_v2_translator.rs] [String cloning overhead] Does cloning collection, token, old_uri, and new_uri during translation cause performance degradation or memory exhaustion with large event batches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: event_v2_translator.rs] [Translation determinism] Are event translations deterministic across all validator nodes, or can race conditions cause different nodes to produce different V1 events from the same V2 event? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: token_event_store.move] [Event emission bypass] Can an attacker bypass the emit_token_uri_mutate_event function and directly emit UriMutation events without proper authorization checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: token_event_store.move] [Feature flag manipulation] Can toggling the module_event_migration_enabled feature flag during event emission cause event duplication or loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: token.move] [URI mutation validation bypass] If mutate_tokendata_uri validation is bypassed, can invalid UriMutation events be emitted with URIs exceeding the MAX_URI_LENGTH? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: token.move] [Authorization model] Does the Rust UriMutation struct enforce any authorization logic, or is it purely a data container relying on Move contract checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: token.move] [Event replay] Can old UriMutation events be replayed or resubmitted to cause duplicate URI changes or indexer state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Struct: UriMutation] [Type confusion] Can UriMutation be confused with UriMutationEvent (the V1 equivalent), causing the wrong event handler to process events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [TypeTag: URI_MUTATION_TYPE] [Address validation] Is TOKEN_ADDRESS verified to be 0x3 at runtime, or can environment variables or config changes point it to malicious addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [TypeTag: URI_MUTATION_TYPE] [Module path injection] Can an attacker deploy a malicious module at address 0x3 with the same struct name to inject forged events? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Struct: UriMutation] [Reflection attacks] Can reflection or type introspection mechanisms be used to access private fields or bypass getter methods? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: API consumers] [GraphQL injection] Can attacker-controlled strings in events exploit GraphQL query parsing vulnerabilities in indexer APIs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration: API consumers] [Event filtering] Can carefully crafted collection or token names bypass indexer filtering logic to hide malicious events? (Low)
